turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You actually forgot our anniversary.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ill fix it.  Ill go out right now and get you something.  Ill make it right.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jack...can we afford all this?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whats the difference? Im taking my baby out for our anniversary, damn the costs...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: How do you even know about this place?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You are so not off the hook yet, slick.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But Im gettin close, right?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I need to tell you something.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Okay...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I think it may help us but theres a slight chance it could make things worse.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Now Im worried...just say it.  Whatever it is well deal with it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I used to be so sure about everything, you know?  I knew exactly who I was and what I wanted. Then one morning I woke up and suddenly it was all different...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Worse, you mean...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.  Well, maybe a few things.  But mostly just different...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I never used to be like this, Kate.  I had it all figured out.  No doubts, no regrets.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: And now...?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Now...I dont...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I think its good to be a little unsure about who you are.  Its very human.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But you always seem so certain.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Cmon, Jack, you think there arent mornings when I wake up and wonder what the hell Im doing in New Jersey...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thats a big one for me, too.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: My office is a dump, I answer my own phone...and youve seen my pay check.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Your pay check is a disgrace to pay checks.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I mean yes, I help people that need it...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I guess...some of them are probably faking.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: God, sometimes I think it would be so nice not to have to stretch ground beef or maybe drive a car with a CD player...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Imagine having a life where everything was easy...where you asked for things and people just brought them to you...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Its wonderful...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Good things...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What are you sure about?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You know champagne makes me do crazy things.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ill just full yours up to the top.  Happy anniversary, sweetheart.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I dont know how you did it, hoss, but you pulled it off.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Im out of the doghouse?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Way out...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Youre so...beautiful...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I already told you you were gonna get lucky, Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: My god, all this time...I never stopped loving you...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Thats all I wanted to hear...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I could stay here forever...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I dont think Id fight you on that one...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pretty incredible, isnt it?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Its like a museum.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So whats the big surprise? You didnt rent this place for the weekend, did you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Think bigger.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: For the week?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This place is a perk, Kate.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: A perk for what?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A company called P.K. Lassiter and Associates Investment House uses it to attract new executives...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Youre talking to their new Vice President of Mergers and Acquisitions.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What are you talking about, Jack?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Are you out of your mind?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I dont think so. This is going to be a better life for all of us, honey.  Well put Annie and Josh in private schools...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Annie goes to a great school.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Im talking about the best schools in the country here, Kate...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jack, what could you possibly be thinking? What about my job?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is New York City, its like the needy people capital of the world.  Those Jersey clients of yours arent a tenth as pathetic as the ones you could get here...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I cant believe you want to move back into the city.  I thought the reason we left was because we didnt want to raise the kids here?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, this is the center of the universe.  If I were living in Roman times, I would live in Rome, where else?  Today, America is the Roman Empire and New York is Rome itself. John Lennon.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I can do that.  I want to do that.  For all of us. I need to do that as a man...  Think about it.  No more lousy restaurants, no more clipping coupons, no more shoveling snow...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Then get a goddamn snow blower!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Dont do that...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look, youre making this into something its not. This isnt a referendum on our lives, Kate. Its a step forward...  Dont you see?  Im talking about us finally having a life other people envy.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Its been interesting, thats for sure.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But Ive done some good things too, havent I?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Youve been Jack Campbell.  And thats always a good thing...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I need you to remember me, Kate.  How I am right now, right this very moment.  I need you to put that image in your heart and keep it with you, no matter what happens.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Are you okay, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please, just promise me youll do that. You have to promise, Kate. Because if you dont, then its like it never happened and I dont think I could live with that.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I promise, Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Promise me again...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I promise. Come to bed, honey.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Kate...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jack...God, its been so long...You look...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You look great.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Its good to see you...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Dont worry about it, Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whats going on?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Im moving to Paris...it was right here...  Its a box marked Jack.  I put it in the stack for the Salvation Army...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Paris?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Youre moving...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Uh huh. To Paris. My firm has an office there and Im going to be heading it up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: To Paris. Paris, France.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Thats the one...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So youre not at a non- profit firm?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Not with what they pay me...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Youre not married, are you?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No, Jack, I never got married. You?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not exactly...  Can we just take a minute here?  Maybe get a cup of coffee or something...?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You cant go!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jesus, Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Dont get on that plane!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please. Lets just go have a cup of coffee. Thats all Im asking for. Im sure theres another flight to Paris tonight.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What do you want from me? You want me to tell you everything that happened was okay?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Dont do this, Jack... But he continues...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We have two kids, Annie and Josh...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Mrs. Peterson.

turns.speaker: MRS. PETERSON
turns.text: Hello Jack.  You dont have to stop singing on my account...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Its because Im shy, Betty.  So, when are you going to leave that old corpse Mr. Peterson and run away with me?

turns.speaker: MRS. PETERSON
turns.text: You know you could never satisfy me the way he does...

turns.speaker: MRS. PETERSON
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thank you, Betty.  I know if I can just sleep this off, Ill be fine...

turns.speaker: MRS. PETERSON
turns.text: And sleep you shall. Noblesse oblige is not dead.  Not yet anyway...Come, lets get you some help.  Surely there must be a shelter somewhere in this city.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A shelter?!  Im the richest guy in the building...Ive got twice the square footage you have!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Peter.  I don't see you rushing home to trim the tree.

turns.speaker: LASSITER
turns.text: That's because I'm a heartless bastard who only cares about money.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And God love you for it.

turns.speaker: LASSITER
turns.text: I just got a call from Terry Haight.  Bob Thomas is nervous...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That'll happen when you're about to spend thirty billion dollars on some aspirin...

turns.speaker: LASSITER
turns.text: Someone's gonna have to nurse him through this.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why are you staring at my breasts, Peter?

turns.speaker: LASSITER
turns.text: I need you, tiger..

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: LASSITER
turns.text: Aspen.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey Peter, lemme ask you a question.  An old girlfriend calls you out of the blue on Christmas Eve...

turns.speaker: LASSITER
turns.text: You suddenly having trouble getting dates?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not by a long shot.

turns.speaker: LASSITER
turns.text: Then leave it in the past. Old flames are like old tax returns.  You keep `em in the file cabinet for three years and then you cut `em loose.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Peter Lassiter...

turns.speaker: LASSITER
turns.text: Do I know you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not exactly. Ive seen you on CNBC.  You look taller in real life...

turns.speaker: LASSITER
turns.text: ...were really more of a boutique operation, as you can see...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But youre not interested in boutique dollars...  I get it...

turns.speaker: LASSITER
turns.text: He certainly has your number, Alan.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Youre a little tougher, Peter.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: For one thing, you like expensive things.

turns.speaker: LASSITER
turns.text: Thats easy. Youve seen my car.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay...you smoke Hoyo de Monterreys. Youre a scotch man, single malt, not because its trendy but because youve been doing it for forty years, and you stay with what works. You have two great loves in your life, your horses and this company. You wept openly the day the Dow hit ten thousand...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: For the money, theyre hands down the best radial we carry...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Okay, Ill take them...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You wont regret it...  Tommy!  Set Mr. Conlin up with four B.F. Goodrich G-Force T/As...  ...and give him ten percent off for having the best costume...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Can I help you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is Kate here? Does Kate live here?!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Kate? No, theres no one here named Kate.  Is that good enough for you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Damn...damn...damn...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hey, are you okay?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No...Im not...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Is there anything I can do for you?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hey, my wifes in the kitchen. You got a cigarette?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Im sorry, no...

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Did you really mean what you said about Tuscany?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Of course I did.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Last night was great...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You are an amazing lover.  You should be giving motivational seminars.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Thanks.  You're not bad yourself...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I want to see you again.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I'd like that, too.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tonight.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: It's Christmas Eve, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So we'll get egg nog.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I have to go to my parents' house out in Jersey.  Would you like to come?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Jersey?  You know what the traffic's gonna be like?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I'm taking the train...

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Don't you have anywhere to go?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I've got plenty of places to go.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Maybe I can try and sneak away some time tomorrow morning...  Okay?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If it's something you feel strongly about.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thats totally see through...

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Merry Christmas...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Christmas?  It cant be Christmas...

turns.speaker: LORI
turns.text: Do you want me to look for the box or call the airline?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Hey, kind of under a little pressure here.

turns.speaker: LORI
turns.text: Hey, kind of giving up Christmas day for my ex-boss here.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You didnt seem to mind offering to help me on Christmas day when you were unwrapping that Prada bag I gave you.

turns.speaker: LORI
turns.text: Maybe its by the wardrobe boxes...

turns.speaker: LORI
turns.text: Ill go for a cup of coffee!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I found it!

turns.speaker: LORI
turns.text: Congratulations. The La Guardia flights canceled but I got you out of Kennedy on United at nine. Am I good or what?

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: You know, you could'a run an ad in the personals.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: "Sensual blind chick seeks three-ton, rock-hard he-man for deep spiritual relationship."

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: This ain't permanent.  My friend Reed's working on a cure...I think.

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: You don't know what it's like out there.  Walking around like some kind of circus freak.  People staring, whispering --

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: I wouldn't know anything about that.

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: I mean...

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: Tell me.  When you grew up in Brooklyn, how many astronauts did you know?  You went your own way then.  You didn't listen to people.  So why start now...?

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: I don't think She's real big on hate.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You wouldn't say that, if you could see me.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: Such a sad face... You know, sometimes being different isn't a bad thing.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Trust me, this ain't one of those times.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: How'd you know it was me?

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: I'm blind, not deaf.  Wanna come in?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm not really dressed for a party.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: Relax, it's casual.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No, I mean...I'm a little...dusty...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Those yours too?

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: My step-dad's.  I'm strictly into stone.  I was wondering when you'd walk by.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: We're going to have to work on your touch.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I like the sound of that.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Good thing it ain't workin... Reed, what are we doing here?  This guy's fast-food, strip-mall science --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: This wasn't our first stop, in case you forgot NASA.  And Victor's not that bad.  He's just a little...  Larger than life.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He's financed some of the biggest breakthroughs of this century.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You'd never know it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I can't take this.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben.  This is business.  Just work.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What about his first born?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben, the money's not important.  We could <u>save lives</u>.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: He <u>knew</u> about NASA.  What if he made the call to shut us down --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben, think about all the people we can help if this works --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Maybe you should think about <u>yourself</u> for once.  You always let this guy push you round --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We got what we wanted.  That's <u>enough</u>.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I know, I know.  I'm just worried about what <u>he</u> wants... Speaking of which...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Can't do it.  I cannot do it.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: External SRBs, orbital system engines. Its just like the shuttles you flew in --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No.  I cannot take orders from that underwear model.  That wingnut washed out of NASA for sneaking two Victoria Secret wannabes into a flight simulator.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Youthful high spirits.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: They crashed it into a wall. A flight simulator.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I'm sure he's matured since then.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: When have I asked you to do something you absolutely said you could not do?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Five times.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I had it at four.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: This makes five.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Isn't that <u>your</u> speech?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He's made a few changes.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: This is your dream, Reed.  You should be the one up there.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Victor's better at these things.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: The shields on the station should protect us.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: <u>Should</u>?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I ain't done arranging your flowers, egghead.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben.  This is serious.  <u>Turn around</u>.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: How long was I out?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Three days.  I was worried about you. How are you feeling?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Solid.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I don't know.  I just keep going over and over the numbers.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Reed.  Even <u>you</u> can't compute every little thing.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I should have done more, run more tests --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You go through something like this, makes you appreciate having the right woman in your life.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Yeah, you and Debbie and perfect --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Reed, I'm not talking about Debbie.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: What?  Come on.  She's got a good thing with Victor --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm sorry, did that cosmic-bath loosen your screws?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He's smart, powerful, successful --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well maybe <u>you</u> should date him.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I think I need to lie down.  Bad shrimp.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What the --!

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben.  Are you okay?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Am <u>I</u> okay?!  You wanna explain that?!

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We had a tough year.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yeah, nine years straight.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You got a chisel round here?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: If we're going to identify the source of the mutation, we need to isolate your recombinant DNA so we can activate positional genomes.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Okay.  I've uh, got some questions, from Sue.  That she thought might be better coming from me... Can you, you know, go to the bathroom...like normal...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yeah.  You don't wanna know the details.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben, I'm afraid I've got to ask --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Not unless you want that clipboard stretched up your --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: O-kay.  We'll skip that question.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It's about to be a broken face.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: This isn't permanent, Johnny.  We need to be careful until we're normal again.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh, you remember my name do you?  You happen to remember what you <u>swore</u> to do with every breath in your body?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We're working as hard as we can --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yeah.  I can tell.  Victor was right.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Glad "nothing" could take you away from your work.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben, I don't know if this thing'll change us back or make us worse. I need you to be patient for a little while longe--

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Time for <u>your</u> lesson, Vic.  Chem 101: what happens when you <u>supercool</u> hot metal...?  Ben...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Got it, teach.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben, I've been crunching the numbers on the machine.  I think if we can rework the power settings...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Forget it, egghead.  I'm good as is.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What the hell you smiling at?  Just keep your mouth shut, and your mind on those SMBs --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Actually, the engines are SMEs. Hydrogenbase, carbon propellant. Couple generations past your last ride.  I'm not as dumb as you look.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: If you behave, maybe next time daddy'll let you drive.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Keep talking, there won't <u>be</u> a next time.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Please tell me your dawg's not trying to rekindle things with my sister.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: 'Course not.  Strictly business.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Yeah, well, his eyes say different.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Hey, two hearts got busted last time. Maybe she's not over it either.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Let's see: you got Victor, stud of the year, more coin than God?  Or Reed, the world's dumbest smart guy worth less than a postage stamp.  Hmmm, it's a toss-up.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Put your tiny little mind at ease.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Don't you wander off, boy.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Where...where am I?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Back on Earth.  Victor's medical facility... We're in quarantine.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Reed? ... Sue?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: They're fine. Everybody else...is fine.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What's wrong with me?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I swear to you they've done everything humanly possible.  The best plastic surgeons in the world, Ben.  You had the best --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Give me a mirror...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: They said that's not such a good idea, the shock alone could --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Give me the god damn mirror!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Hey!  That's a <u>prototype</u>!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Go back to the drawing board.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: The machine works.  And Vic's gone Mister Hyde on us --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Really?  With a name like Von <u>Doom</u>? Never saw <u>that</u> one coming.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No more cracks about how I look.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Hey, I'm Mr. Sensitivity now.  Clear the way, wide load coming through.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'll be watching over you.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Just get back soon, or I start looking for a new groom.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Soon as I'm back, I'm gonna trade that in for a bigger rock.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I don't care about rocks, I care about <u>you</u>.  You bring him back in one piece, or you can forget being Best Man.
